title: Heavy showers above 100 mm expected today
byline: Showers or thundershowers have been predicted at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern and North-western provinces today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Ex-President Ranil to appear before CID today
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to appear before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (11).

title: Three killed in separate road accidents
byline: Three individuals, including a youth, have died in three separate road accidents that were reported in Mankulam, Ambanpola and Warakapola yesterday (10).

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas in Gampaha today
byline: A 10-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in the Gampaha District today (11), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Austria school shooting death toll rises to 11 after victim dies in hospital
byline: Ten people have been killed in a school shooting in the Austrian city of Graz, in what is the deadliest gun attack in the country’s recent history.

title: Los Angeles protests: Mayor imposes curfew ‘to stop the looting’ as police make 197 arrests
byline: The mayor of Los Angeles has announced that a curfew will be in force overnight, as officials attempt to “stop the vandalism and stop the looting”.

title: Elephant goes on rampage during Mihindu Perahera in Badulla
byline: A tense situation has been reported during the Kailagoda Mihindu Perahera in the Badulla town last night (11) when a distressed elephant went on a rampage.

title: Earth safe for now, but Asteroid 2024 YR4 may hit the Moon in 2032, warns NASA
byline: The probability of Asteroid 2024 YR4 hitting the Moon has increased, according to astronomers making observations from the James Webb Space Telescope.

title: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya brought to court
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and subsequently remanded until today, has been brought to court.

title: Revised electricity tariffs will be announced today - PUCSL
byline: The revised electricity tariffs for the second half of 2025 will be announced today (11), the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has said.

title: Over 300 pieces of Princess Diana’s dresses, handbags, and more head to auction
byline: There have been many Princess Diana-related auctions held over the years—Lady Di herself auctioned off than 79 of her dresses at Christie’s in 1997, in fact—but the sale taking place at Julien’s Auction later this month may be the biggest yet.

title: Pakistani man who allegedly plotted US attack extradited from Canada
byline: A Pakistani man was extradited from Canada to the United States on Tuesday to face charges of plotting to carry out an attack on Jews in New York City, the Justice Department said.

title: Sinkhole under track disrupts train services between Kandy and Peradeniya
byline: A sinkhole that appeared under the railway line in Kandy has caused disruption to train services between Kandy and Peradeniya stations.

title: NPP secures power in Bandarawela Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has succeeded in establishing control in the Bandarawela Municipal Council.

title: 15 injured in bus accident in Wellampitiya
byline: A bus traveling from Monaragala to Colombo has met with an accident in Wellampitiya along the Avissawella-Colombo old road.

title: Superintendent of Anuradhapura Prison further remanded
byline: The Superintendent of the Anuradhapura Prison, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department and subsequently remanded over allegations of unlawfully releasing an inmate of the Anuradhapura Prison under the presidential pardon for Vesak Poya, has been further remanded until June 13, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Police to provide 24/7 security for Chabad houses in Sri Lanka
byline: Steps have been taken to provide security around the clock to Chabad houses across Sri Lanka.

title: Special bus service between Peradeniya and Kandy railway stations
byline: Special buses have been deployed to transport passengers between the Peradeniya and Kandy railway stations, Sri Lanka Railways stated.

title: Sri Lanka continues to attract large number of Indian tourists
byline: The latest figures released by the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) indicate that the country continues to attract a large number of tourists from India.

title: Cabinet nod to draft amendments to ban corporal punishment in Sri Lanka
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted policy approval to formulate a draft bill to enforce a ban on corporal punishment in Sri Lanka.

title: Electricity tariffs increased by 15%
byline: The electricity tariffs will be increased by 15% with effect from tomorrow (12), the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced.

title: Cabinet decides to pay half of suspended Prisons Commissioner General’s salary
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to pay half of the salary of the Commissioner General of Prisons, Thushara Upuldeniya, who is currently in remand custody, for the duration of his suspension.

title: Argentina’s Supreme Court upholds 6-year sentence for ex-president Fernandez
byline: Argentina’s Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld the six-year prison sentence for former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner over irregularities in public works contracts during her time in office.

title: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons further remanded
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) and subsequently remanded, has been further remanded until June 25, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: SLPP wants ‘corruption-free’ person appointed Colombo Mayor
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) says the opposition should be given the opportunity to nominate a Mayor for the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Sri Lanka committed to closing gender pay gap and supporting care economy - Labour Minister
byline: Addressing the 113th Session of the International Labour Conference (ILC) in Geneva, Sri Lanka’s Minister of Labour, Anil Jayantha Fernando, reaffirmed the country’s strong commitment to promoting decent work, strengthening labour rights, and advancing social justice.

title: BASL urges to strengthen transparency and accountability in Prisons Dept operations
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has express its serious concern regarding recent reports of an inmate allegedly released from Anuradhapura Prison under the guise of a Presidential Pardon, without having followed proper legal process.

title: Taiwan struck by 5.9 magnitude earthquake
byline: Taiwan was struck by a 5.9 magnitude earthquake Tuesday evening, the United States Geological Survey reported.

title: President Anura Kumara lands in Berlin to begin Germany visit
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who left the country yesterday on an official visit to Germany, landed at the Brandenburg International Airport in Berlin, this morning (11).

title: Ex-President Ranil arrives at CID
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement for around one hour, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Former maid at Keheliya’s residence arrested
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested a former domestic worker who had been employed at a residence of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella.

title: Foreign cigarettes and whiskey bottles worth over Rs. 24 million seized
byline: Sri Lanka Customs officers have discovered 1,612 cartons of foreign cigarettes and 10 bottles of whisky concealed inside 26 packages declared as household furniture and personal goods at the cargo processing warehouse of a logistics company in Colombo 09.

title: India ‘hopeful’ of reaching deal with US before Trump’s tariff deadline
byline: Delhi is “hopeful” of reaching a trade agreement with the US before the 90-day pause on reciprocal tariffs ends on 9 July, India’s foreign minister has said.

title: CAA releases weekly estimated essential food prices
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has released the estimated price ranges for several essential food items.
